newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonia share trade picks up, free market lively.
newsitem.headline: Estonia share trade picks up, free market lively.

text.p: Estonian shares were lively on Thursday with the over-the-counter free market the focus of attention as it outstripped the main list, dealers said.
The free market had volume of 11 million kroons while the official list saw business of just over five million kroons. The Tallinn stock exchange index dipped 0.21 percent to 103.77.
"Today's trade on the free market proved the viability of the over-the-counter market," said Hansapank dealer Mart Meerits.
Drug market Tallinn Pharmaceutical was the most active on the free market at turnover of six million kroons.
But it closed slightly lower at 53 kroons versus 54.03 kroons.
The Rakvere meat plant was also active on trade of 1.9 million kroons and it rose further to 6.35 kroons from 6.10.
On the official list, Hansapank was the most active at 2.9 million kroons turnover but it ended down at 103.80 kroons after 105.15 kroons.
